language._snackAlreadySetAsDestination: File "%FILENAME" is already set as destination.
language._snackAlreadySetAsSource: File "%FILENAME" is already set as source.
language._snackRemoteWithCultureExists: The remote file with culture "%CULTURENAME%" already exists.
language._snackNotCompleted: File "%FILENAME" is not 100% complete. The readiness of selected file is %READINESS%. Try to load it as destination file and complete the work.
language._snackNotCompletedAndExist: File "%FILENAME" is not 100% complete and already exists as remote. The readiness of selected file is %READINESS%. Try to load it as destination file (or get remote one) and complete the work.
language._snackFileIsNotCompleted: File "%FILENAME" is not 100% complete. There is complete remote file. Please, use it as source.
language._snackFileWithCultureExists: The file with culture "%CULTURENAME%" already exists.
language._snackElementWithIdExistsInSection: The element with id "%ELEMENTID%" already exists in section "%SECTIONNAME%".
language._firstTimeSourceSaveSubMessage: The project basic culture will be set to "%CULTURENAME%". Continue?
language._firstTimeSourceSaveMessage: This is the first file in project.
language._remoteIsLessCompleted: Remote file "%FILENAME" is less completed than local one.
language._snackElementWithIdExistsInSingleSection: The element with id "%ELEMENTID%" already exists.
language._localIsMoreCompleted: Local file "%FILENAME" is more completed than remote one. Would you like to upload "%FILENAME" to remote server?
language._asComparedToRemote: The readiness of local file compared to remote is %READINESS%. Do you want to proceed with local file anyway?
language._isMoreCompletedThanLocal: Remote file "%FILENAME" is more completed than local one.
language._questionUpload: Would you like to upload "%FILENAME" to remote server?
language._questionUpdateFile: Would you like to update it?
language._warningLostDestinationData: If you have any unsaved destination data, it will be lost.
language._messageIdenticalSource: There is identical remote file. Please, use it.
language._warningBothIdentical: Both remote and local file seem to be identical.
language._questionProceedLocal: Do you want to proceed with local file anyway?
language._warningDestNotAllowed: Action is not allowed while source file is in edit mode.
language._warningDeleteElement: You are about to delete the following element. Are you sure?
language._warningDeleteSection: You are about to completely delete the following section (include all child elements). Continue?
language._warningUnsavedSource: There is an unsaved source file.
language._warningUnsavedDestination: There is an unsaved destination file.
language._questionUnsavedSource: Close it and discard all changes?
language._warningOpenSource: There is an opened source file.
language._questionCloseSource: The file will be closed before proceeding. Continue?
language._chkShowCopyButton: Show copy button for source fields
language._chkSwitchToNewProject: Switch to new project after creation
language._warnRemove1: You are about to completely remove selected project.
language._warRemove2: To confirm enter REMOVE into field below.
language._warnPrivate1: You are about to restrict public access to selected project.
language._warnPrivate2: To confirm enter RESTRICT into field below.
language._snackGrantedAccess: Public access has been granted to project "%PROJECTNAME%".
language._snackRestrictedAccess: Public access to project "%PROJECTNAME%" has been restricted.
language._warnFileDele1: You are about to delete the file "%FILENAME".
language._warnFileDelete2: To confirm enter DELETE into field below.
language._snackInvalidEmail: The email address is badly formatted.
language._warningAccountDelete: You are about to completely delete account "%ACCOUNT%". THIS OPERATION CANNOT BE UNDONE. All information related to this account will become unreachable.
language._labelReenterPassword: Enter the previous password again to confirm the operation.
language._snackUserNotFound: There is no user record corresponding to this identifier. The user may have been deleted.
language._snackResetPassordEmailSent: The password reset email has been sent to "%EMAIL%".
language._snackInvalidUserPassword: The password is invalid or the user does not have a password.
language._snackMissingProject: The project "%PROJECTNAME%" has been either deleted or marked as private by its owner.
language._snackFileAlreadyExists: File "%FILENAME" already exists. Choose another name, please.
language._helpAbout1: Feedbacks, suggestions and bug reports are welcome at
language._helpAuth1: For the very first time you enter the program, you will see the following login prompt
language._helpAuth2: Here you can see various login options, while logins with providers like Google, Facebook etc will bring up popup windows for appropriate provider.
language._helpAuth3: Other login options are explained in next sections.
language._helpAuth4: You may always change login way by clicking "Switch account" button at the page's footer.
language._helpAnon1: Anonymous login gives you restricted work options. All you can do as guest is working with local files of only one type
language._helpEmailLogin1: Login with email and password requires registration, so, when prompted for the first time, hit 'SWITCH TO SIGN UP' button.
language._helpEmailLogin2: Provide valid email address in order to be able to receive forgotten password. Password should be at least 7 characters length.At the sign up dialog you can also add optional user name and user photo url.
language._helpEmailLogin3: All this parameters, except email address, may be changed later.
language._helpSettings1: Choose 'Settings' button on the toolbar or quick access 'Settings' button.
language._helpSettings2: Settings dialog consists of two tabs.
language._helpSettings3: At the 'General' tab you set general options
language._helpSettings3_1: Whether to show quick access buttons on load
language._helpSettings3_2: Whether to show copy button next to source file fields
language._helpSettings4: At the 'Active project' tab you select the project you want to work with, or 'none', if you don't want to work with any of available projects.
language._helpSettings5: After selection you will see the details of selected project, such as files type (xml or json), brief project description, sample code and so on.
language._helpSettings6: If you select 'none' as your active project, you could choose the default project type to work locally, when no one of remote projects is selected.
language._helpProjects1: There are six types of projects available for creating and working, and two types of files: XML and JSON.The common thing for all kinds of projects is an 'culture' element, located at the root level of language file.
language._helpCreateProject1: Choose 'New project' button on the toolbar or quick access 'New project' button.
language._helpCreateProject2: After selecting new project type you will be prompted to fill a required fields
language._helpCreateProject2_3: Project creator (by default the field will contain your user name)
language._helpCreateProject3: Public access to project is set to 'true' by default, but you may clear the checkbox in order that nobody, except you, will see the project.
language._helpCreateProject4: You may also check the appropriate checkbox and switch to the new project after creation.
language._helpCreateProject5: After creating the new project you have two ways to add the very first file
language._helpCreateProject5_1: Hit the 'New file' button on the toolbar
language._helpCreateProject5_2: Hit the 'Local source file' button on the toolbar
language._helpCreateProject6: After loading or creating/saving new file you will be prompted to set the file culture as project basic culture.
language._helpManageProjects1: Choose 'Manage projects' button on the toolbar.
language._helpManageProjects2: After selecting a project you will be able to change the project description, project public access level or remove the project.
language._helpLoadingSource1: You load remote source file by choosing either 'Remote source file' button on the toolbar, or correspondent quick access button.
language._helpLoadingSource2: After hitting the button you will be redirected to 'Choose file for source' page. The page is divided in two parts: 'Completed' and 'Partial'.
language._helpLoadingSource3: Each part consists of individual cards
language._ownBackground: This is background of your own files
language._otherBackground: This is background of other users files
language._helpLoadingSource4: Only completed files can be used as source. Find desired file and hit 'TRANSLATE' button.
language._helpLoadingSource5: You can download both your own and others' files to your local machine.
language._helpLoadingSource6: You can also delete your own files, unless it is a basic project file.
language._helpLoadingSource7: You load local source file by choosing either 'Local source file' button on the toolbar, or correspondent quick access button.
language._helpLoadingSource8: After hitting the button you will be prompted to select local file. The file type and structure should match the selected project type.If it is not(e.g.you select XML file with multiple sections for project with single section) - you will get the loading error message.
language._helpEditingSource1: While you may edit any text in selected source file, you may add/remove sections and elements ONLY for basic project file, i.e.the file whose culture you have set as basic project culture(usually it happens when you create new project and add the very first file).
language._helpEditingSource2: You may do the following for projects of types
language._helpEditingSource3: In any kind of project you may remove an element
language._helpSavingSource1: Once you have changed the source file you may save it
language._helpSavingSource2: And, of course, at any time you can download the source file to your local machine.
language._helpDestFromScratch1: In order to create new destination file just choose needed language in drop-down list and start translation entry-by - entry.
language._helpLoadingDest1: You load remote destination file by choosing either 'Remote destination file' button on the toolbar, or correspondent quick access button.
language._helpLoadingDest2: After hitting the button you will be redirected to 'Choose file for destination' page. The page is divided in two parts: 'Completed' and 'Partial'.
language._helpLoadingDest3: Each part consists of individual cards
language._helpLoadingDest4: You may translate only your own files. Find desired file and hit 'TRANSLATE' button.
language._helpLoadingDest5: You can download both your own and others' files to your local machine.
language._helpLoadingDest6: You can also delete your own files, unless it is a basic project file.
language._helpLoadingDest7: You load local destination file by choosing either 'Local destination file' button on the toolbar, or correspondent quick access button.
language._helpLoadingDest8: After hitting the button you will be prompted to select local file. The file type and structure should match the selected project type. If it is not (e.g. you select XML file with multiple sections for project of single section type) - you will get the loading error message.
language._helpEditingDest1: Editing destination files is a pretty straightforward task.
language._helpEditingDest2: If 'Show copy button for source field' is selected at settings page, you can copy each source field to the correspondent destination field and then continue to edit it.
language._helpEditingDest3: There are some additional available actions
language._helpEditingDest3_1: Capitalize each sentence in destination file
language._helpEditingDest4: The last option will switch-on automatically if you are editing files for languages like Hebrew, Arabic and other right-to-left languages.
language._helpEditingDest5: Hitting 'Clear destination' button will clear the destination.
language._helpSavingDest1: Once you have changed the destination file you may save it
language._helpSavingDest2: And of course at any time you may download the destination file to your local machine
language._helpAccounts1: Choose 'Manage account' button on the toolbar.
language._helpAccounts2: If you log in using one of authentication providers, you can only delete the account.
language._helpAccounts3: If you have created new account, you may change the password, user name, photo URL and, of course, delete the account.
language._helpFooter1: At the footer area you can quickly change active project, login way and UI language.
